text: I think that I am being generous with 3 stars. I ordered an O'Hare Stout and BBQ chicken wings (to go)...the wings were expensive..$12.00+.  When I got home I discovered that they were "Buffalo Wings" and not the BBQ wings which was disappointing.  I had ordered the BBQ as this place boasts about their BBQ specialties and fried chicken on the menu. The first team member Darren was really interesting and told me about the history of the place...which brags that Harry Caray and Bill Veeck as well a Jimmy Durante used to frequent the establishment. Darren stated that Harry Caray and Bill Veeck would hand out complimentary tickets to patrons when they were eating at the restaurant.  There is even a "Bill Veeck" wall of pictures some autographed by famous baseball players. The odd thing is that the couple sitting at the bar right next to Bill Veeck section asked a portly bartender with short brown hair if he could change the TV channel near them from Football to The Cubs Game and the bartender abruptly stated that he would not and told them..."Go ask the manager."  Really....how rude and odd considering the place oozes of baseball.....I am sure Harry Caray would be rolling over in his grave if they knew about this....... Will not be returning.
Pretty cool place with some neat history to it. Great atmosphere all around on the inside. The food is just as unique and great tasting as the atmosphere on the inside.

Peter the man up front really helped me out of a jam, what s great guy! Chicago is busy, like I can't get a dinner reservation anywhere busy, anyway I eventually got in to Millers after a wait. What a great environment, so much cool history and charm. All the food we had was delicious! I will definitely be adding this place to my list of places to visit every time in Chicago!

I've always walked past this place when I worked in downtown Chicago. I always assumed it was a smaller pub with very few draft beers but boy was I wrong about this place. This pub was a lot bigger than I thought. They serve a varir of craft beers on tab and in bottles. They have great food options such as there wings, which were great by the way. There portion was great as well. I had a prime rib sandwich that came with cole slaw and good amount of French fries. Everything I had was really good. The service was good as well. They were always checking up on us and making sure things were great. Overall, the atmosphere was great for a pub and food was good.

Stopped in after work on a Monday night, place was busy, but seated quickly. Took about 10 minutes for server to take my drink order. Once she started, food came fairly quickly. Greek salad is amazing, cheese curds are good. I thought the prime rib was okay.
Classic Chicago bar/eatery. Great long bar and large dining area. Food is pretty average, 2 stars but general vibe gets them to 3. It's not a corporate chain!!!

Okay, this restaurant totally made me think of the 1980's.  We ordered a couple of filets and a prime rib.   The cuts of meat were huge, and came with a potato side, and a salad.  I upgraded to the Greek salad and it was good.  The rolls before dinner were appreciated.  The beer menu was extensive.  We were seated near the bar, so it was a little loud. We wouldn't come here for dinner too often, but once in a while it would be a nice throwback. The prices were not cheap, but they were also not nearly as expensive as the other a la carte steak houses nearby.

Miller's Pub is open until 4 AM. I started going here because there were very few places to eat if you worked a late shift. I did--years ago--they were still on Adams St at the time. It was such a blessing to be able to go to a nice restaurant like this!  They made a great cup of coffee--which I really needed!  I also fell in love with their "egg lemon rice" soup--which also has a Greek name.  I don't go downtown very often these days. After Summer Dance this Sunday we went to Miller's Pub. The place still has a lot of charm. The coffee is still great. The egg lemon rice soup wasn't on the menu :(   I asked the waitress about it. She said you have to ask about the soup and they happened to have some that night.  So I was able to have a cup :) and it is still great!  I ordered the Beer battered cod sandwich--it was not great--just okay. I liked the coleslaw but the fries were not very good. My favorite soup saved the meal for me! I suggested this place, so I hoped my friend liked her meal. She had the Broiled Salmon with mushrooms and rice. I asked her about it for this review:  "Minimally, but perfectly seasoned.  Just about licked the plate clean".  It is nice when your friends enjoy the place you picked.  It got very busy shortly after we arrived and it was difficult to get the waitress' attention.  Also, Ladies room is small and rather clumsy. If there is a line, you have to watch so you don't clunk someone with the door--or get clunked! Still love this place and hope to be back soon.

We loved this Chicago icon! Right around the corner from the Palmer House so we stopped in to make a reservation for that night. When we arrived, the gentleman in the front remembered us & we were seated right away. Water was at the table immediately & the server was there in 5 minutes. We discussed entree specialities & our drinks were served along with a basket of bread - the bread basket includes these yummy garlic toasts - we asked for more & he brought us a whole basket! The ribs were wonderful! I had the Greek chicken which was so flavorful & juicy! Everyone loved their dinner + service was prompt so we could be on our way to the concert - all done in just under an hour.  Reasonable prices too.  We will go back...

We stopped by here on our quest for late night dinner (we're talking 11, so most other kitchens in the area were closed or closing).  The host was friendly when we arrived.  It was a little dark and felt a little dreary inside, but not totally outside of what you'd expect for an Irish/English pub.  We were seated on the dining side, away from the bar and televisions.  I was fine with that since we just wanted to eat.  I'm not sure if you can eat in the bar, but that might be nice if you were out with friends and wanted appetizers.  Our server was polite but a little absent as we were looking to pay the check and leave.  Even though it was very dead and the servers were mostly standing around.  I ordered the tuna melt and my date ordered fish and chips.  Both were fine.  Nothing amazeballs, out of this world (but not that I'd expect Irish food to be amazeballs in general).  But also nothing wrong with it.  The portions were sufficient; I walked out with leftovers.  Overall, not super memorable but not a bad experience.  I'd stop in again if I find myself in the area but I'm not likely to seek it out.
We got the BBQ Burger and open-faced meatloaf, both of which were excellent and very filling. The food came out rather quickly and the service was great. Would recommend to a friend.
Delicious food, open late, lots and lots of beer and interesting cocktails! Fun decor and attentive waiter. Would recommend while in Chicago.

I've been coming to Miller's Pub for quite a while with a friend who loves it.  We've had many good meals before shows here and been served well.  My experience yesterday soured that good sentiment.  I stopped in with a couple friends visiting town for the weekend.  We wanted to sit down and order a bunch of appetizers and have drinks.  The person at the front desk told me that if we weren't having dinner, we would have to go to the bar.  Seeing that there weren't ample chairs at the bar (which we didn't want to sit at any way) we were told we would have to stand if there weren't seats.  Mind you, we were not visiting during a peak dining time (it was late afternoon) and there were plenty of tables open.  Turned off by how rudely we were treated, we left and continued down the road to another restaurant that had no aversion to seating us.   There's no doubt that Miller's has a great vibe and it worth an experience.  Having dined there before and now having been turned away from a table, I've experienced it enough and likely will not be back.

Went for lunch about 1pm today (Monday) - seated right away and service was attentive. Ordered the fish and chips - came fairly quick. Fish was hot and fresh, not greasy. Very good! Fries were hot - nothing to rave about but they were good. The one thing that disappointed me was that a bar, with a great selection of wine, beer and spirits, did not have Malibu rum. I had a taste for Malibu and pineapple juice - waitress came back and said no Malibu - mainly spiced rums on the list. Malibu is a staple in most bars - it's nothing fancy but with the selection of bottles behind the bar, it is surprising they did not have it. Ended up ordering a strawberry daiquiri that was not great. It was not frozen - more of a mix of melted ice and base. Although I was disappointed in the drinks, the food was very good as was the service.

Unique Irish/English pub tucked next to the 'L' tracks. I arrived late to Chicago and took a cab to my hotel which was around the corner. The hotel restaurant had closed for the evening. The concierge pulled out a map and pointed to a few places that sounded scripted, and then said: - "...you always have Miller's Pub around the corner from here."  -"Sold." I replied, there was something about their answer that made it the obvious choice. The city was sleeping and I did not many people on my short walk towards there, but inside was a complete different story and the place gave me the impression that it never sleeps. I was greeted by an gentlemen in his 60 or 70s who was standing behind a counter with a cash register on it. The gentleman came out from behind the counter to great me and gave the hostess instructions on where I was going to be sitting.  I sat next to the bar and ordered a plate of fish and chips with a beer on draft. It just felt appropriate. Food was great, beer was perfect, ambiance was welcoming. Go, you won't be disappointed.

My reviews are mixed and they aren't even considering the food, because, well, I've only been here after 10pm for some post drinks cocktails. So let's give it points for it's history and longevity. Assuming that all the reviews are accurate, sounds like they offer a good menu so points for that too. Now, for the cocktails. Every time I've been here, it's been nearly impossible to find a spot at the bar. The last visit, there were no less than 4 booths with reserved signs on them and yet it was after 10pm and highly unlikely that these tables were being saved for people looking for dinner. I take a star away because last time when I asked the server about the status of the reserved tables, I was told very rudely that some people want to eat. In my mind, I'm thinking and some people want a tip; which I would give you if I were allowed to sit at this table and an empty table equals zero tip. The cocktails seem pretty standard. A few beers on tap, full bar, but I don't recall ever being given a drink menu.  The bar is made up of a lot of hotel staying folks from around the corner so it's a mixed bag of locals and tourists/business travelers. Bartenders have been pretty attentive. Drink prices seem average. I would say it's a staple in Chicago and good for the area, but not sure it would hold it's status in many other areas of the city.

My first Yelp review... Asked the guy at the front door to change a TV to the Cubs game and he refused because it was on another TV. The bartender was cool. The guy at the front door was a jerk, no other way to put it. By the way, nobody was watching the tv we asked him to change. Crappy attitude, lots of other places to grab a drink

First, Vicky and Gustavo were taking care of our table and they are the most welcoming, friendly and helpful people possible. They truly made our visit! Amazing service! The prices were reasonable and the food portions large, quality was outstanding! I had the ceaser salad...best ceaser salad I've ever had! My boyfriend had the turkey club...anothed best we have had. The meat was amazing, especially the bacon! Even the mayo was spread perfect! I can't say enough about this place...we will be back for sure soon!!
They are open late.? Yes, They are open late.  If you need a late night drink or food it is a decent place to go.  If the hotel restaurants and bars are still open don't come here.

I come here every time I go to Chicago. It is very good. I always am with a big group as well, and the service always takes care of us very well. Caesar salad, French fries, steak sandwich. Only thing I don't like is that it is in a tacky area.
As always delicious, but not only is the food quality top notch but the service exceeds my expectations. Ask for Jackie she's amazing!!

Popped in for a late lunch and was not disappointed. Had the Greek burger (it came slightly undercooked, bummer), it was tasty. Cocktail list is nice, they've got a few originals and lot of great classics on there. The beer selection is solid, good variety, and lists where each beer is brewed, shock I personally like. Overall, I'd gladly come back next time we are in town.

Jackie our server is a bubbly young lady. We loved the food and their service. Millers is a nice place they also have a reasonable price. I had canadian baby back ribs and The husband had butt steak- yum! I love the sweetness of their coleslaw as well.

Went here to try their signature steaks since I was in the mood for steaks but it was Okay. I had their 10 oz butt steak with French red wine which came with salad. I ordered an extra lemon soup too. The meal was OK or decent. Nothing extraordinary. I thought since it was in the older buildings next to Jewelers row in Wabash Ave it would be extraordinary. It was not. It was Okay again. I do like the nostalgic ambiance but food quality needs some updates. Especially the salads and soups. Their Tiramisu for desert was unique and tasty for the best. I would come here every now and then but it won't be the 1st thing to think about if I had to take someone out for a date. Good bar if you want to hang with friends. Steaks was OK.

The atmosphere of this historic pub is great. Dark, cozy,  stained glass, oil paintings on the wall. The food was outstanding. I had Greek chicken.  Very tender, juicy,  Greek salad. My husband had broiled cod special.  So why the 2 star review?  Staff makes all the difference. Our waitress was a nervous Nelly goofball.  Her name was Vicky and was just loopy.  We've never been there before so she let us look through the menu and did bring us drinks.  BTW,  the Kentucky Mule was delicious.   Then I ordered the Greek Chicken.. It was supposed to come with oven roasted potatoes and spinach pie.  I also ordered a Greek salad and soup.  Then here's where she turned nutty.  Lol my husband ordered the cod special. As soon as he said "I'll have the cod". She literally ran away sputtering,  I have to get this in because it's going down. OK we thought she wants to get the cod in before it runs out. Then 5 minutes later she runs back with my soup and literally runs away again.  My hubby never finished giving his order.   So finally,  crazy runs back with a salad for me and he said to her,  "I never finished my order and you ran away" " she said " well I was nervous and needed to get your order in" and he said "that's fine but I'd like to order a salad and find out what the cod comes with ".  She said" well you get what you get and you have to pay extra for a salad'. Me having the bigger mouth then my husband said" well that's fine give him a salad" she was so damn quick and nervous it really ruined the mood.   She flew away again and he also wanted a baked potato but that never came out because she was like a fart in the wind again. While I'm still eating my salad she throws are dinner plates on the table.  I absolutely despise that rushed feeling  of eat and get out when we wanted to relax, unwind have drinks and dinner.  She was so annoying I didn't even realize I never received the spinach pie and she gave me a baked potato which I gave to my husband. Anyway,  the atmosphere was great,   food tasty but don't sit in Vicky's section,  she's nuts.
Kevin is one of the friendliest, most genuine bartenders. We came in for beer and liked his company so much, that we stayed for a meal.  Would go back the next time we are in Chicago!

This is a warning to those considering dining at Miller's Pub at the bar...DON'T. There are pickpockets posted at the bar.  Tonight, I saw a customer catch someone reaching into his pockets. He notified the bar management; their response was "it happens". I was so disgusted that they did not do anything to stop this. Their attitude showed that they allow this type of crime in their establishment. I just want to sound a warning so that no other customers have this experience.

This place has a very classic vibe to it so you feel like you've stepped back in time. The food was great as well. Had the blue cheese burger and it was perfectly cooked, medium rare and was ready real quick. The waitress didn't even ask how how I wanted the burger, ha. Plus they had the ballgame on multiple big screen tv's. All in all a good experience.

Party of six. Had a nice table, good service. Food typical bar food that was cooked hours before and was laying around. Ribs were a specialty but were dry, over cooked, over sauced and Tiny (old joke - food was awful and such small portions). Wife quarter chicken was greasy and flavorless. Everything was too expensive for the quality. Saturday night and the place was packed. Well it served it purpose as a venue to have a family get together.  Side salad and baked potato were good, never saw any rolls. Drinks never refilled. Like a bad Greek diner.
Stopped in for a few drinks and to catch the end of a ball game. Great selection of beer and house cocktails. The bar staff were very attentive. This place has a pretty decent atmosphere.
Great spot in Chicago. Can get very busy.  Kevin at the bar was very welcoming and service was great!
Very attentive bartender. Great atmosphere. Good food. Good drinks. I enjoyed my visit to Millers very much.
Exceptional food and service! (Brad) Ribs, shrimp, mashed potatoes, blue cheese dressing, coffee.....all really good! I would definitely return!

I was hoping they would have great bar burgers but I was disappointed. The bun was dried out and wasn't grilled. The burger was also dry with little flavor and the fries were nothing special. My friend had the lettuce wedge and thought it was good.

This place is always busy, so it's difficult to get a seat at the bar or a bartender's attention, but I love the pictures and autographs- this place has years and years of stories on the walls and I will go in just to check these stories out. The photos are mixed, old with new so it took me a while to find my Jack Benny autograph, but it's up in the front and makes me smile!  I think it's a bit too dark in there, and the ladies bathroom isn't the cleanest, but like I said earlier, I come here to read the history on the walls.

Pros: Great location and historic vibe to the interior. Good beer selection  Cons: pretty poor service, the server seemed like she wanted to be somewhere else. Food mediocre and overpriced. Clearly this place is targeting dumb tourists that don't know any better. Good luck to them.

A no frills steak house is a welcomed establishment among the fancy schmancy ones you'll find in downtown Chicago. This is my fiance's favorite steak house in Chicago, so we made it a point to stop by on our last visit home.  We made reservations and were promptly seated. Our waiter grabbed drinks for us as well as the ever-tasty bread basket. Fiance and I split the prime rib and our friends got the surf and turf and the ribs plate.  The entrees came with soup or salad and I opted for the lentil soup (side note: why is it still 40 degrees at the end of April? Damn, Chicago, this is why I moved). It was SO good! Now, the main event. The prime rib was good. Had a lot of fatty bits in it as prime rib does. I have to be honest and say this prime rib was probably ruined for me by the amazing meal I had had at Manny's in Minneapolis about a month prior. But I wouldn't refuse this prime rib, either. The mashed potatoes and carrots served alongside were just okay.  Next time I come to Miller's I'll probably mix it up with their many food choices. If you want to just sit back, relax, and enjoy good company in a no frills kind of place, check out Miller's Pub.

This bar is a throwback to last century. Bartenders wear vest and ties, booths are upholstered with green vinyl and separated by stained glass. The lighting is dim, but the beers are cold.  The menu is a mashup of Irish pub grub, Greek diner and midwestern fare. Somehow it all makes sense because it's all comfort food.  Worth a stop if you're in the neighborhood and want some late night eats or to watch a game.
Fun place, nice atmosphere, this is the only bar in the area for late-night until 5am.  Huge selection of beer, nice smoke-free environment.

As previous Yelpers have stated, Miller's Pub is an old-school restaurant under the el tracks in the heart of Chicago's Loop.  I have been going there since my days as an undergrad at DePaul.   My family and I recently revisited Miller's since we were downtown for a concert at the CSO.  The ambiance hasn't changed since it opened in 1950, but is comfortable and quaint.  The menu has something for everyone.  But I'd give our dinner a 2 star rating.   We ordered onion rings as an appetizer.  They were terrific.  I think Miller's uses Panko as their breading which gives it an awesome crunchiness.   Then came the entrees.  It's hard to try to make a fair assessment of our food, since it took way too long to arrive at our table, and was barely tepid (which makes me crazy).  For our entrees, my daughter and I had the BBQ pulled pork, and my husband ordered the open-faced turkey sandwich. The BBQ pork was tasty, but there was so little of it on the bun that it wasn't worth the cost.  The fries were cold, but OK.  The cole slaw was fine too. The turkey came with mashed potatoes and gravy, but both were barely warm. For dessert, two of us shared the chocolate cake a la mode which was OK.  I had the key lime pie which had a vague soapy taste.   All in all a disappointing meal.

Old school bar restaurant in the heart of downtown Chicago. The food and service is excellent. If the wait is too long for a table go sit at the bar. They don't have the TV's blasting with noise. The fish and chips and prime rib sandwich are excellent. It's a 10 min walk to Millennium Park and Lake Michigan. Can't wait to go back.
This time capsule is a joy and food is great.  Get the dinner salad with entree and you get assortment of rolls and good value.  This is sweet home Chicago, through and through.

Yet another restaurant I've passed a million times and never stepped into until recently. Seems a lot smaller from the outside. We didn't order a full meal, but the spinach and artichoke dip? Yum. Rarely a wrong choice. A sizable and varied beer selection, always appreciated. I see a few other reviews describe this place as old school and that is pretty accurate. Its cozy, it's kind of dark, even in the daytime, and it has a "lived in" vibe (in a good way). I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I'm in area, I'll stop in.

I was so disappointed with my takeout from Miller's Pub.  The ribs had great reviews, so I was expecting something much better than what we got.  We ordered a full slab (or maybe even a slab and a half) of ribs.  When we opened the to-go container, we were disappointed to find a tiny little tip of ribs that was overcooked.  The weight of the actual meat was FAR LESS than what a slab and a half should have weighed.  I was left wondering, where's the meat. I'll never spend my money here again.  What a rip off!
I really enjoy this classic Chicago bar. It's very old school and cozy.

Worst service ever! We were a party of 7 and two friends joined afterwards. Even though there was enough room to add a couple of chairs, they were very obnoxious about it and very rude. They kept reminding us that there's a $7 minimum per person even though we were all consuming. After about 1 hour they asked us to leave because they had a reservation for the table. I had some friends visiting for the weekend and I regret them coming here and leaving with a bad experience from Chicago.
Really good food! I'm walking around Chicago hungry and ran into this place great food!
This place just screams 'classic Chicago'. Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. Will want to come any time I'm in the area.

I've been to Millers Pub a few times and I've never been disappointed. Saturday I went with my girlfriend. The wait was shorter than expected and the food came out pretty quickly. Their chicken specialty was bomb. My burger was tasty as well. Our server Keith was really awesome. He took great care of us. The drinks are good also.
It's a tradition! Food selection good, taste is better than fair. Atmosphere crazy but warm & old-timey.

This place is old-school in the best sense of the term.  It may not be the place you take a first date to impress her or him, but it is a comfortable, classic place that wears its age well. I'm glad that old-fashioned places like this still exist. The food is quite good. I've eaten her three times, and while I wouldn't put the steak up against the best steakhouses in the city, it was pretty good. I might recommend some of the more casual offerings--sandwiches and salads are quite good here.  The staff is attentive, and while the place may show its age, it is clean and comfortable.  If you want a restaurant low on pretension with good food and service, Miller's will do the trick.
Pretty chill. Amazing service , friendly staff, good selection of drinks and food

I've been here lately to meet with friends for drinks, after-work drinks, and drinks with the wife. All that drinking may have clouded my opinion, but I've never had a bad experience. The beer list is excellent with drafts from all the best Chicago breweries (Revolution, Half-acre, Three Floyds, etc.).  Prices are reasonable for the Loop.  Food has been solid, too. I've tried the wings, spinach dip, fried shrimp, and steak sandwich. All of them are basics. None of the food is overwhelmingly fancy, which you see a lot of downtown. Just good, well-prepared, piping hot food.  Our service has been equally solid. Drinks refilled quickly, food served very quickly (perfect for before a show), and very positive service from sharp-witted servers.  Overall, I've been looking to expand to other spots, but I keep coming back to Millers because I know I'm going to have a great experience.
Average food but good selection of beers on tap. They didn't serve in a pint glass, what they gave seemed more like 12 oz., not worth a second visit.

I actually like Miller's and have been to this location in the past.  My first time was good.   Recently,  my food was still good.  However, the waiter was not great.  It was Not extremely busy this night, so I  am not sure what happened.   The waiter served our food and never came back to check on our party.  We had to find him to request the check !  I probably will not return to Miller's Pub,  maybe check out some more spots in the area.   However,  I  would not discouraged anyone from going here ( just make sure you get a good waiter :)  )

Great atmosphere and attentive service highlight Miller's. The food is really good too. You'll be able to find some excellent specials at a good price, I had the Bourguinone pot pie, and it was excellent.
Attempted to buy some dessert for take out & was told no now: WTF? Who turns down business. If you decide to go don't be surprised by how. customer unfriendly they are

It's an institution and a good late night spot. Bartenders can be rude in a somewhat charming way.  Food is prob a 4star in that old school comfort style. Waitstaff is 4.5 star, attentive even when busy.

I love Millers. Classic old school Chicago Loop. OLD school. You will see oldtimers in faded plaid suits from the 30s slumped over the bar swigging Old Fashioneds and Manhattans. OLD school. The food is actually good if you navigate the menu carefully. This is basic stick to your ribs Chicago grub cooked by Greeks. I miss this food dearly. Others have mentioned smelt. I like it, it's caught basically right off the lake (I know, I've caught them there!), but it's a quirky local dish like Rocky Mountain oysters. Get some to share, and then move on to hearty comfort fare. I've had excellent raw oysters at the bar. The bar is FUN. Real slice of Chicago life, or people fleeing from conferences. Nice beer selection and they'll make you a cocktail too.
Very very very good ribs! Loved every bite! Gave the feel of being at someone's house. Very laid back.

I've been coming to Miller's since I was a little girl (Yes, I've been eating steak since I could talk and I love it!) I feel like this place is a city staple. If you love Chicago, you have to come to Miller's at least once in your life. I don't think the inside of this place has ever changed, and that's a good thing.  For the city, Miller's has great prices. Of course they have delicious food, it's why they've been open so long. Come here for the soup, lamb, and steak. The prime rib sandwich for lunch is one of my favorites. I always find it weird that the bread and butter come out cold. Guess they ain't got time for that. I'm ok with that. Also, if you're a drink snob, don't get all flustered when they say they've run out of your beer. It happens a lot. Luckily, there's enough choices at the bar so I don't think you'll go home disappointed.  The waitstaff is nice, but everyone is so quirky. I've never had an uninteresting server here. Sometimes that's a good thing. Sometimes it can be a bit of bad thing. I'm ok with that too. Oh, and sometimes it's so dark in here you will feel like you entered a cave or you're having a stroke. Just keep blinking. That's the best advice I can give you. I feel like if you come to Miller's and you like Miller's, then you have to accept all of Miller's. I do and I'll be back as always.

Exactly what you would expect from a pub that's been around since the end of WW2. Classic comfort food and pub fare, good beer list, great bar, stained glass makes great ambiance. Impeccable service. We really enjoyed it after an architecture walking tour. My dad had fish and chips, which were huge! Husband had chicken pot pie - absolutely amazing, tasted like Grandma made it. My mom and I split their famous Greek salad. I would definitely skip salad next time (chicken was so dry it was like chewing cardboard). But otherwise met expectations.

I ate here twice since I was staying next door at the Hilton Palmer House. Both times the service was outstanding. On one occasion I had a hamburger. The hamburger was huge and I was barely able to finish it. The second time I had ribs. They were just okay. Huge beer selection and a great old fashion bar restaurant vibe. Highly recommend stopping here.
Nothing fancy, but great food and service. Definitely a spot to choose when you want a solid meal everytime. Recommend the ribs, of course, but some of the best fried fish in the city.

So excited to try a Chicago restaurant rich in tradition. The atmosphere is great. Old school paintings and celebrity pictures(most of which are signed) is great. That's where the magic ended. Service was mediocre. And never having been here, I tried the ribs as they claimed "world-famous". So disappointed in the ribs. When they arrived, they were pretty small. But I thought oh well. However, when i tried them, they were dry and tasteless. World-famous? More like barely edible. Sooo... disappointed.

They get a 4 star, because they are the ONLY place in the loop that is open late.... full menu of diner/pub/bar food until 130 AM and full bar until almost 3 AM.  This will be my go to late night spot in the loop.
The food is nothing to write home about, but Miller's definitely has the stiffest and most affordable martini in this area.

Had an old-fashion feel. A Maitre D in a jacket and tie. Lots of staff for service. Food comes incredibly fast. Nothing exceptional but was a good meal. Pricing is reasonable. Nice atmosphere, although very loud. My salad was good, wife's sausage with peppers was good.

Solid place where we enjoyed a nice lunch. The Greek salad was excellent, the beer selection was very good and the main dishes (filet and pastrami sandwich) were very tasty. My one gripe would be that the bread given at the start was beyond hard. I will definitely go back, but would probably not eat any of the bread again.
We had just driven 11 hours to get in town and were ready for a relaxing meal.  The food was very good....though too much dressing on the Ceasar salad.  But out waitress Amy from Ireland was great!!

Not friendly at all. Don't expect them to go out of their way to make your experience enjoyable. And don't even think about switching from one side of the bar to another! Insanity. Good beer selection though.

I had the Tom & Jerry right after Christmas and it was fabulous! I also want to give them props on serving my friend and I after Lollapalooza. We were dirty, sweaty, and famished, and Miller's Pub treated us like family.

We had a party of 6 and they said it will be 45-1hr wait.  After waiting 10minutes our table was ready!!  The waitress was great. She checked in on us multiple times for drink refills and appetisers  while we waited for the main dish.  The best thing you can order is their chicken wings! We split a slab and half ribs between two people and it was more then enough food we even had leftovers.

Probably the most horrific bar I've ever been to, and I've spent a lot of time in Southern California bars.  Literally, the creepiest, most alarming bar staff I've ever encountered at a bar. Stay away.

Looking for a valentines night dinner while visiting Chicago we decided to try Millers Pub.   I've been here before on business trips and the food had always been decent.   My wife had the Chicken Parmigiana and I had the Bleu Burger The burger was cooked to order and the cheese was perfectly tangy.  My wife  thought the chicken parm was just ok.  The sauce from the spaghetti was a bit watery and soaked the chicken before it could be eaten.   This resulted in a bit mushy piece of chicken.   Service was mediocre at best.   Check ups on drink refills never seemed to happen without flagging someone down and when going back to the restroom we saw why.  Most of the staff was leaning up against the back wall typing and swiping on their phones.  A shame really.
Old school classic. Food is good not great for 4 stars but mid 20th century vibe gets it to 5. Very eclectic crowd too, especially late night at the bar.

Hadn't been in over 20-25 years. Still as great as ever.  Used to be a pre- or post-CSO haunt. Great food, reasonable prices for downtown, and timeless surroundings. Forgot how much I had enjoyed going here. Now that the old Berghoff's dining room is long gone, it's good to see Miller's Pub and the Exchequer still going strong!

We were really impressed with the place. The ambiance was really nice and the steak was amazing! Our waiter couldn't have been nicer and a down to earth fellow Chicagoan.  Definitely will make a return trip.

Solid after-work spot for drinks and dinner with an old school vibe. Huge beer list with a great rotation on tap. Food is consistently delicious. Waitstaff is attentive, friendly, and professional. Been coming here at least once a week for the past couple months!

We just love this place.  Old time feel, lots of wood, fun Christmas decorations.  Good food, excellent beer selection.  And it was Tom and Gerry season - the most awesome hot drink - ended our evening with this.

I went here this past Friday with a group of 11 and they sat us right away. Very impressive considering they were busy and it was Christmas weekend. The waiters were all extremely friendly and fun, which made for a great atmosphere! The service was quick and we all loved the food and drinks that we ordered. They have a huge food and drink menu that includes food from Italian dishes to ribs. Would definitely recommend!

Regular stop for the family when we're in the city. The artichoke dip with pita chips is awesome! Burgers are huge and delicious. Tried the Greek salad last night with Greek Chicken; very good, just wish the olives were pitted.
My go to spot when I get a late flight in - open late, good beer menu and solid bar food.   I usually keep it simple here, but they do have prime rib and some nice Greek choices on the menu.

Perhaps the rudest staff I have ever encountered at a restaurant. It was very busy and the hostess was YELLING at everyone to not block the aisles as they waited. Our waitress was extremely rude when I asked her to check on ingredients for my child who has a food allergy (we did call ahead and asked if they could accommodate food allergies, and they said: yes, just notify your server). As we were leaving we walked past another waitress telling her table (they were seated in the main busy walk way) that if they wanted a different table they would have to wait back in the line for one) Ordered the burger and it was fine. The food for my child came with a side that he was allergic to - even after our lovely talk with the waitress.

Miller's Pub has a nice atmosphere, but only average food and drink options. My party mostly had burgers, while I had the pulled pork BBQ sandwich. Everything was standard, though unspectacular. The same went for the apps we ordered. Everyone enjoyed the food, though nothing was good enough to warrant an immediate repeat visit. The place certainly draws a crowd, but really the food is no better than many other similar spots in the Loop, such as Exchequer.

this place is bumping!! This is a great place to hang out with friend for a beer and dinner. We went after work and this place was amazing, we really felt what it was to hang out with fellow peeps in Chi town... I had their lamb chop which was on point and also shared a liver plate which also was good... I also tried some of there other plates their and they didn't disappoint. if your looking for a place to sit down and have a romantic dinner, guess what this is not the place. Next time you wanna catch up with friends and have a couple go here it will not disappoint

So good. I stayed next door at the Palmer House for a week- so naturally, I ended up at Miller's a few times. The ribs with fried shrimp came with a salad to start, corn on the cob and steak cut fries. It was delicious and such a steal coming in at just over twenty bucks. Their open-faced meatloaf sandwich is a great option if you're in the mood for some good ol' comfort food.The appetizers are legit too- my friend raved about the hot wings and fresh onion rings. The place is super cute and and the service staff was friendly and attentive. The only real drawback is that I didn't see many young people hanging around. Great place to eat- maybe not so great place to meet people.  See you next time, Miller's!

As always great service. Stopped in after lighting of the tree ceremony.  Had a dink at the bar while waiting to be seated. Didnt wait long. Ordered the special of the day, shrimp mac and cheese with garlic bread. Although there was not a lot of shrimp the dish still packed a punch in taste. Cheesy goodness with bacon and peas. greatcdish for a chilly evening. Staff is always very friendly.

Atmosphere: not my thing; food: surprisingly delicious. Had their BBQ burger and was surprised at just how good it was. Two patties, perfectly cooked, with a nice thick slice of cheese, deep fried onion rings and a crisp two rashers of bacon. The fries were alright and I didn't try the coleslaw, but the burger was top notch. Good beer selection, too.

Classic diner with above average food - open late and perfect if you got the munchies.   Had some red meat and Greek chicken (whole, half portion), which were all pretty good.  Nice Greek salad, served the right (cold) temperature.   Friendly diner style service - even for late night.  Good spot to come, if you don't know where to go when it is 1-2am in the morning.  Just watch out for the hobos outside...
It was great for a good dinner before Hamilton! George provided excellent service. Food was very good, reasonably priced, fun atmosphere!

Tourist trap, average food and poor service. I was disappointed by h experience here as the venue seems to have a history within the city.  Most of the customers were of a senior age and not really somewhere I would take my friends.

Not sure what else to say....a FANTASTIC bar located in the Loop. Great bartenders/servers. Quite the extensive food, drink, and beer menu.  Do NOT skip the ribs - THE BEST!!!  I also opt for the wings as they are very flavorful and go great with fries and a cocktail or beer.  If you want something a little healthier - the Greek salad is AWESOME. A piece out of Chicago history including visits from players on the Sox, Cubs, Bears, Bulls and Blackhawks teams, news anchors, politicians and actors! Beer List - If you want a beer that a lot of bars in the city don't offer - go here!  The owner/manager hand selects the taps, usually having a few local beers, regional, and cross country.   Some of the Best people watching or mingling in the city.  The Palmer Hotel is right next door and since this place is open very late - 4a late, the crowd is an eclectic mix of locals, tourists (including international, national, and locally), Expo participants, and both blue and white collar city dwellers.  The last night I was in here was the weekend of the Rugby Tournament - there were folks from Ireland, Australia, Sweden, and more! If you are anywhere in the Loop, you gotta check this place out!  I miss it as I used to frequent when I worked in Chicago Loop and lived in Lincoln Park.

Millers Pub was my favorite stop during a conference in Chicago this summer. The service was friendly, they had ZOMBIE DUST ON TAP!, and the space was just awesome. Millers was so good I came twice. Next time I'm in Chicago I'll be back.

Food was good, ribs were not the best nor the worst I've ever had.  The spinach dip was excellent.  The beer list is excellent as well. The atmosphere was great for the cubs playoff game.  The waitress was new and really didn't know the beer on menu or much about the food.  Experience overall was just ok!
Wtf this is not edible food.. I wouldn't even feed this to my dog, speaking of dog is that what the meatloaf is made out of?

My husband and I happened upon this Pub after a long day of touring in Chicago. It was early on a Wednesday evening , maybe around 5 p.m.. We were tired and hungry , and very ready to eat. The place was pretty full but we were seated immediately and received prompt service. I ordered the Reuben , which was actually the best Reuben I have ever had! My husband had a trio of fish combo and he was not quite as satisfied. As we were there the restaurant continue to fill up until every open dining spot was taken and again this was on a Wednesday night. I think that shows that they're doing something right!

I went on a history tour of Chicago that ended at Miller's pub because of it's historical nature. Most of the bartenders have worked here their whole lives and celebrities from across the world have visited.  The inside is almost original and feels like you've stepped back in time about 25 years.  There is plenty of seating for large groups but they also have a nice bar area if you just want a drink. The menu is quite extensive but I think they are best known for their greek salad and burgers so I decided to order the Patty Melt and it was exactly what I was hoping for.  Not too greasy with a healthy serving of french fries.  Overall the food was nothing out of the ordinary but good classic options and service.

Miller's pub has good food, not spectacular but just okay. Dim lighting but I guess because it's a pub. I got a hummus platter and it was pretty good, while my friend had lab chops with mashed potatoes. She liked the food as well. Platter was huge I ended up having leftovers. Nice.

Awesome old school Chicago bar. Went there For a shot and a beer and chatted with Michael the bartender who was knowledgeable about the city and very friendly. Loves the atmosphere and the menu items looked good. Lots of history behind this place, you have to stop in for a drink when in the loop

A solid pub-resturant.  Food is decent and decently priced.  Good service and good drinks at reasonable prices.  Very nice atmosphere.  Good value for the service given.  One of the better meals from a pub in Chicago.

I've already prefaced this in previous reviews, but I've been coming here since I was in high school (uncle friends with owner). Tonight I ran into an issue I've never come by before: our server, Jonathan, wouldn't serve us the complimentary bread. Normally/previously, I request for bread no matter what I order, many times just an appetizer and bottle of wine for late evenings, and they give me bread no problem. Our server,,Jonathan, sternly told us that they/he won't serve bread if I don't buy an entree. He also reaffirmed he's worked there for years - I've never seen him in the countless of times I go, but okay.  Didn't care for him or his 'tude. It was my first time bringing this particular friend there, so the lack of hospitality that I'm familiar with, was a damper.

Being from California, I'm certainly not a regular here but I've stayed at the Palmer House two years in a row and found myself at Miller's on three occasions. We had some drinks among a tight, noisy crowd in the later hours. Nothing to write home about but no complaints. Last night, however, we stopped in for a late dinner after a long, long day. All we wanted to do was sit down and have a good meal. And we were not disappointed. We had excellent service (Jackie was a doll!) and amazing food. The build your own burger option was calling to me. Avocado, fried egg and Swiss. I will be thinking about this burger for weeks! It was fantastic!  My boyfriend went with the fried chicken dinner and loved every bite. They said it would take about 30 minutes to prepare but we had it in 15.  Excellent choice of beers and some fun, unique cocktails. Will absolutely be back!

Very near Millennial Park and the Chicago Art Institute. It was the only one we found, while staying within the Downtown Loop area, that was neither an overpriced, pretentious place nor a chain (or "chain-like") restaurant serving mediocre food.  This place has nothing to prove and provides simple but excellently prepared meals with prompt and courteous service, at a very reasonable rice. The very old-style bar look might put off some people as being a sort of dive where locals get drunk, but it really is a fine establishment where the wait staff is in traditional white shirt/black tie garb and families of all ages came to eat. I had that night's London broil which was served medium with a very finely flavored Burgundy sauce, with a side of steamed green beans (fresh, not from frozen) and a perfectly browned twice baked cupcake-sized serving of mac and cheese for about $15.  My husband has their blue cheese burger that had at least 3 oz of actual blue cheese crumbles  on top.

I am a guest here more times than often. Recently they just hired security! The Hurd came up to me and told me that I had to leave, I complied! The group that was sitting close to the door was able to remain! Why?

Love, love, love Millers Pub. Been eating here for 35 years and it never changes. Experience and efficient waitstaff who are knowledgeable regarding menu and beverage options; they deliver a steady stream of courses but aren't hovering. Food offerings decidedly American and taste delicious. Sadly, portions are so generous that there's no room for dessert! Perfect meal option before a CSO or theater performance. Hopefully this lovely pub, tucked in under the L tracks and next to the Palmer House is around for another 35 years!
This place is great. The service was great. The baby back ribs, coleslaw, corn on the cob and fries was great! Lol. They give you a lot of food! Nice place to come and relax!

This is the place to go if you're really hungry and staying in the downtown area. The Gallios family has made it a point to make sure the service and food are both given that touch which leaves you feeling satisfied. To top it off they have a very extensive beer and cocktail selection. Don't listen to the other reviewers who gave this place 3 stars or less. Forget the overpriced swanky joints that give you very little of nothing and go to this place. I highly recommend it.
Best old school place ever. The bar a must! Can't rate the food because I haven't had any but the bar is so Chicago! Must go!!

Old Chicago restaurant we found on our visit. Ribs and coleslaw were great, as was lamb with mint jelly. It is hard to find these days. Had key lime pie for dessert which was tasty. Our waiter was great and attentive. We had such a good time we went back the next night. We ordered different items, steak and chicken, which was just okay. It's still worth a visit though.
Great local restaurant with Chicago flair.  We had lunch there and ordered salads and they were fantastic!  Service was great too.
Great food, service, and atmosphere. Old Chicago for sure. For a dinner.... Ribs are superb. Steak is great. Pasta great too. Don't miss this even if you go for a drink.

I am wildly disappointed because I ordered the surf and turf.  When it arrived the steak was room Temperature. I mentioned it. I didn't get any apology but the dish went to the microwave.   Sad.   Expensive and disappointing. I never give harsh reviews but in this case the shoe fits.
Pretty neat pub to stop in for late-night! Open til 4am, serving food til about 1am or so. I had the half and half ravioli spaghetti plate and it was huge plenty enough to share! Good drinks too!

Great place, eat there every time in Chicago! Love the Reuben sandwich! Only knock would be the fish and chips, the fish was like something you get at a high school cafeteria WTF everything else is great!
Pretty good over all, ribs were good just a little salty , soup was salty as well, girlfriend agreed

This place has amazing service and food. We had a party of 7 with kids. Our server was fun and very friendly. She recommend the Ruben sandwich and a few other choices from the menu. I went for the Ruben and boy was I happy. The sandwich was done correctly and was fantastic! The fires were great, and the coleslaw was creamy just the way I like it. Portions were a good size. Will come back and split a meal next time. If you like Bloody Mary's you have to try theirs. They make the mix in house. Complemented my meal very well. All in all I had a great experience and would recommend you stop by, have a beer, and get the Ruben sandwich or their signature fish and chips.

Lively pub atmosphere, extensive menu and beer list, something for everyone, great ribs, attentive service, reasonable prices, large portions, nice sense of history and place, very convenient next door to the Palmer House, fine for families. A nice find, reliable option.
It's an upscale dive bar. Plenty of drinks to choose from. Serve food late. Popular for the loop area. Close to hotels. Popular by all types of people.

Well known place, I can say round the world. I had coworkers who patronized Miller's Pub more than 25 years ago. They are still remembering how good ribs were here. We had to go to refresh memories from the old times. Still same good portions and delicious ribs. I don't know back then, but this time I didn't like pushy server. Let me enjoy the meal. Thank you.

Do not order the ribs.  They suck. Typical fare is really good.  Have had a reuben, and the burgers are great.   The Greek specialties are good.  Beer selection is good and they make a good drink.  It's an old school Chicago spot.

Definitely would not recommend this place. There was no greeting at the door by the host staff, the manager seemed irritated to even be there and our server couldn't be bothered to even give us his name. The food was mediocre, at best. I had to wave down my server for anything that I needed, as he paid attention to every other table except mine. Honestly, the nicest person in the entire place was the busser, who I accidentally bumped into on my way out.

If you´re in the loop near the millennium park. And want to stop by for a round of drinks or to have some food. Miller´s Pub it´s a great option. They have a long list of drinks, beers, vodka, whiskey, bourbon, etc. It closes at 2 pm. And the prices are ok. Most of the dishes are big enough if you are starving.
Ribs were good. Great service. Kitchen was open late. The prime rib sandwich was awesome. The piece of corn was tasty but way too soggy and small..Great place

Was very satisfied with this meal and would return again. The calamari was better than some high-end places I've been to - soft, not chewy with large chunks of squid and octopus. Stayed at Palmer House and came here for lunch after leaving 3 other places on Wabash. They were all fast casual with limited menu, and we wanted full service and option for full bar. The menu had many options and a lot of people were getting sandwiches (and taking leftovers to go). We Ordered full slab of baby back ribs with chicken quarter, calamari and got a small Greek salad and fries on the side. Wasn't even expecting everything to taste so good! The feta and kalamata olives  in the Greek salad were delicious. $55 all in with 2 beers (before tip). No wait to sit, good service. Don't judge by the look of it, the food is GREAT and there's sports on, if you like that sort of thing.

My date and I came here after watching the movies in Millennium Park one night because he wanted a chicken sandwich and this was the only place we might find that at 10pm. I had never been here before even though I have lived here for 8 years. The place seems like an old Bennigans when you walk in.  There is stuff everywhere and booths for people to sit. I have to say I was surprised how many people were here. Apparently this is a late night stop for many people. I had the Mediterrain hunmus plate and my date ended up getting a hamburger. The hummus was pretty good and came with some pita. The waitress was really great and patient with us and explained everything we asked about. We even had a pleasant exchange about living in the hood. I am not exactly going to run here again but I know where I am going for late night food in the Loop next time!!

Spent all day trying to decide where to get  great prime rib dinner. Decided to go to Millers. Let me tell you it was the greatest prime rib we had in a while. I would certainly recommend Millers for a great prime rib dinner. Enjoy.

I went to a business lunch here. Most of the menu is meat oriented. Although, there are some fish selections. There are also lots of fried choices too. Not much to enjoy if you are vegan or dieting. But that is not their fault. If you walk in here expecting some vegan or low fat choices you have walked into the wrong restaurant and that is on you.  I had the Chinese chicken salad (without the chicken), but it came with no dressing. No problem, I asked for some and it was cheerfully provided.  Some folks in my group complained that their fries were cold. But overall, I thought the service was good. This place is a good choice for meat and carb lovers among us.

The Grandson wanted ribs for dinner, so I checked Yelp and found that Miller's Pub in the next block had 'em with good recommendations. We got there about 7:15 PM and had a short wait. The service was quick and I ordered a Martini which was excellent. So good, in fact, that I had another one! Grandson got a Green River at my recommendation. It is a Chicago lime soft drink and has always been my favorite. You can't get them anywhere but in Chicagoland so if I drive here, I always take a case home to be doled out slowly! The ribs, I was told, were excellent and I enjoyed my roast lamb. We had a tiramisu for dessert and with two drinks, the tab was $89.00 before tip.  Our waiter was excellent - a typical old-time professional waiter that the world lacks too few of these days. I will certainly go back again if I am staying in the Loop.

Miller's has been a favorite for years, for lunch, dinner, and (very) late night snacks/drinks. The greeters still wear coat and tie and make you feel like you're coming into a 1940s speakeasy. The bar has a good assortment of beers and a staff of competent bartenders to serve them quickly and cold. The menu has something for everyone, with decent portions that aren't ridiculously huge like at the tourist restaurants (looking at you, Grand Luxe). No one makes you feel rushed, so if after your meal you want to have dessert in a shot glass or beer mug, that's no problem at all.

I was here over the weekend for a birthday party so there was plenty opportunity to try a few things from the menu. The calamari was excellent! So were the ribs, I would definitely recommend getting those again. The service was good. Also, make sure to get your parking validated before you leave..It will be $12 instead of $46..

Solid 3 stars... Stopped in to whet my thirst and ended up ordering wings. Great beer selection as well as a full list of appetizers. I tried the wings with buffalo sauce and had to stop myself from eating the whole dozen! Crispy and spicy with generous sauce, served with cool blue cheese that packed crumbly cheese below the creamy goodness. Ambiance is library dark bario and prices are in line with locale...ill be back to try other options when back in the city, but this joint does not make the list.
Great ambiance, but fish and chips were really bad. Fries were mushy, fish was frozen, and cost was high. Great bartenders though and decent beer menu.

Open late and still serving a full menu and just off the Monroe red line; we were lucky to find this place when we needed more booze and food.  Each table has drink menus that have cocktails, a small wine list, and tons of beers.  Love their manhattans, they use buffalo trace so you know it will be alright. The food menu goes all night until close.  They have a huge list from sandwiches to steaks/chops to BBQ ribs to Italian to burgers.  Typical American flavors so don't come in expecting sushi or pizza. I recommend the calamari for appetizers and whatever specials they have.  I had the shaved leg of lamb (shaved meaning no leg, just the lamb) which was served with rice and spanakopita.  Garnished with mint jelly, the lamb was alright.  Served in on a plate of juices so it doesn't go dry.  Definitely tastes better with the jelly for some reason.  Rice was whatever, the spanakopita was probably the best of the dish. Good solid spot.  Especially when you're roaming the streets at midnight.

We stopped in here not knowing what a gem and Chicago cornerstone this restaurant is.   We absolutely loved it!  Being from Tampa, I was super surprised to find a really good Greek salad here!  And my brothers loved the spanikopita and the relentless beer selection.  I got the filet and baked potato and one of my brothers got the Canadian BBQ ribs.  Really, really good!!!! The service is crazy,  it's so fast.   I will definitely be back.
Came upon this place since it was around my stay at Palmer House. Not a bad choice. Service was great and food was good. Got the baby Canadian ribs and shared it among 3 people.

Was on business in Chicago. Great place in the downtown area serving typical pub food.  Not what you would call a frills place, but good home coking type pub food, friendly staff, what more could you want.

Beer selection is on point! Plus their menu boasts a history of each beer.  So many trappist beers both on tap and in bottles. The place is dim and just a classic Irish pub, very lovely polite bartenders. I very much enjoyed it.

Love it being a nice hangout, But the Cowboy steak was not the greatest.....I'll try some of the other steaks.......Next time around......Yet the salad was great, But NOT for the next day..... P.S.: Don't take the salad for a doggy bag, Big mistake.....Eat & finish what you can.....
A++++ The Caesar salad was soooo good and the chicken pot pie was BOMBBBB. I wish there was a place like this in Michigan!

I'm eating at this establishment for the first time. I have to say the ribs were great.  I had a baked potato small Greek salad, and the calamari was great too.  the key lime pie was okay but the thing that disturbed me the most was the hostesses were not friendly and that's why I'm only giving them 2 stars.  The hostesses were more interested in their personal matters.  Buyer beware.  Hope the manager takes this to heart and correct the problem because it's a shame to this business because the food is great.

So conveniently located right around the corner from the Palmer House, this place was exactly what I needed after an exhausting day.  We stepped inside for a late lunch on a hot day & I was immediately calmed by the dark interior, the perfectly cool temps, & the immediate warm greeting.  We were led to a very comfy vinyl upholstered booth, from where we could see a few TVs at the bar.   The extensive menu was hard to choose from, so much good stuff!  Everything we had was great: Butt Steak - LOL I have never heard of this cut, but it was flavorful & juicy, chargrilled perfectly rare, topped with a handful of onion strings, and served with comfort foody mashed potatoes & gravy and coleslaw (my selections from their choices) BBQ Ribs & chicken - I'm usually not a pork rib fan but this slab was so flavorful & super moist, and the chicken was so good too.  The sauce was sweeter Texas type bbq, that was slightly spicy, the way I like it! Our gracious server was spot on efficient and fast in the kind of no-nonsense way that I love about classic steakhouse type places. I loved everything we ate, & though I just as easily could've ordered the burger with bacon & a fried egg, the sirloin steak & eggs, the open faced meatloaf sammich, the fried chicken, and the key lime pie. And I bet it all would've been really good too. Yep, I'd gladly come back!

We ate here Saturday night and liked it so much, we came back again tonight.  Very broad menu (tip: order the Greek chicken) and excellent service from Kenan.  Good selection of wines and craft beers at reasonable prices.  Both nights were under $50 plus tip.

I really think in average three and half is a fair evaluation.  It is on the corner of my staying hotel so I came on my last night. The entire place is very heart warming like a nice pub. The dimmed lights and big screens are good for sports watching, like the Cubs game. Since I don't know what to drink, my waiter offered my two tastes. And finally I picked Belgium White to match my rib-chicken combo. O Dear, it came with a huge baked potato and a bowl of coslaw. The full rack seems a little shrieked and short. My grilled chicken with home made BBQ sauce is highlight of the night. The meat is tender and the sauce is a combination of sweetness and spicy. The ribs however is over seasoned. It is too salty and the meat is very tough. I also love my beer!! Without the defect in ribs, it would be a perfect dinner for my last day of visiting Chicago.

Wow. We came in to just kill time before an event. What a find! We ordered sandwiches and was amazed that our order was out in less than 10 minutes! On a Friday night! Sand which was Sooo good. Would have it again and again. Definitely worth a try.

This was my second visit to Miller's, the first being back in December on a previous trip. The first visit we watched a Bears game and the place was packed with a good crowd. It wasn't as busy on a Thursday night and we sat at the bar and were served quickly. The bartender's are attentive, but not very chatty. They have a great selection of draft beer and the decor is perfect pub ambiance. Not the best food in town but come for a beer and soak up a bit of the history

This is a nice pub with amazing food. They have a great drinks menu and all their food was magnificent. It was in a great part of town and very friendly staff. The ribs are world famous and their desserts are to die for. Great great place.

This is a really old bar predating the current establishment that dates to 1950. Rich in wood it exudes old fashioned class. I found the prices to be reasonable given the location. I ordered the Canadian slab of bb ribs that came dry rubbed but a bottle of house bbq sauce was also served. Both were quite tasty. Given the wide variety of menu items it took me awhile to make a decision but was good choice.  A side said came with the meal and I ordered blue cheese. I didn't know there was a 1.50 charge but didn't consider it unreasonable given the loads of blue cheese crumbles that covered the salad. A basket of assorted breads was also included which were tasty but would have been better warmed. There seem to be issues by some with service but mine was ver good and friendly. He was there promptly after we were seated, answered our questions about the menu and got our drink order. He was attentive without hovering or interrupting us. I'm only in town for a few days so don't know if I'll get back but will definitely consider it.

Any place that you can grab a beer to go along with your order of corned beef hash and eggs is a winner in my book.  True, the place hasn't changed and is somewhat dated but that is one piece that I like.  It doesn't try to be something that it is not.  Beer selection is solid and the hash was exactly what I wanted and needed.  Simple.  Solid.  Perfect nightcap for probably few but A-OK in my book!

Nice divey sports bar. I guess you'd call it an Irish bar. Brings in the tourist for sure. I only came here for drinks . They were strong and a martini will run you $11. Service itself was good. It's dark in here. That's the main thing I'll take a way from here. If you want to sit at a table they want you to eat, fortunately our server was nice and let us sit there and drink instead of having to stand at the bar all night. Nothing blew me away about Millers, but nothing really turned me off either. Was just an ok experience.

Don't just stop in for a beer with a group at midnight on a Monday and expect a table in the bar area without ordering food. That was a pathetic business decision to give us the ultimatum of standing to have a drink or sitting and having to order food. Good luck with that Maitre De.
Great beer list. I just went in for a couple drinks and apps. The waitress... I guess meant well but was super rude and clearly wanted us gone ASAP.

I was told they had unbelievable blue cheese dressing as redo lupus as that sounds. But what goes better with that? Wings. And they can make some killer wings too. Had the medium and they were just about perfection. Despite a couple weird shaped wing hybrids they were so delicious and made me want more. Also the jalapeño Moscow mule was delicious. Highly recommend.

Miller's Pub is one of those places you go to more for the history and the atmosphere than the food.  Don't get me wrong--the food is fine--but what's really fun is seeing the interior of the restaurant, all the signed photos, and really getting a feel for the city of Chicago.  I love Miller's Pub because of fond memories and good feelings; it's kind of a Chicago classic.
London broil great. Really enjoyed burger.  Plent to choose from for all tastes.  Price was reasonable.

A 30-minute wait at dinner to get a table in this place?  Seriously?  Ordered the "fish and chips"...worst I've ever had at ANY restaurant - worse than the frozen stuff you buy at Jewel.  Also tried the "famous ribs"....way below average...especially for the price.  Speaking of price, everything is overpriced.  It's too bad the food is so bad here - amazing interior/old-world ambiance.  I guess that's what the line is for.

The food is great and the drinks are cheaper than most places in the area. After a long day at the art institute galleries we indulged in sloppy joes and open faced turkey sandwiches. Our server, Josepha, was great! Will definitely be back on our next visit!
Had so much fun here with a friend. Met the locals. Had some nice conversations. Bartenders definitely know what they're doing. Great place!

I would just like to begin by saying that I am not a native to Chicago. I am from Seattle. I moved to this city feeling as if I had moved to Antarctica based on how lonely I felt. I found this bar simply because I lived close by and it had (apparently which was true) the best ribs in town. I quickly became a regular here and suddenly, I didn't feel as lonely anymore. I don't like to "put myself out there". I don't like anyone to feel obligated to speak to me. So when I went, I would happily put on headphones and immerse myself within whatever the Internet had to say. The more I came in though, the more the bartenders got to know me and took a liking to me and were genuinely interested in my well-being and life. I got to know them eventually and with as many patrons they receive including regulars on a daily basis, I never felt like they had an obligation to talk with me. These people are very real and willing to open up to an extent if you are to them.  On an abysmal night that took place a couple of weeks ago, I had an unfortunate circumstance where I lost my wallet because of a friend that took off running out of the bar unexpectedly. Upon my return and realizing what happened, I cannot put into words how accommodating the manager Chris was. Even though I cried ten hours straight that night, he made things better. These people are not just good people, they are some of the best people Chicago has to offer. In my nine months here, this is the only place I have felt comfortable. If you have no friends or family, if you are going through something terrible, if you have lost someone, or you don't know where else to turn, trust me, these people will do their best to make you feel better and it won't seem like an obligation.  James, Tony, Francisco, Beaker, Darren the night manager Chris and the wait staff are some of the most high caliber bartenders, mangers and waiters/waitresses I have ever encountered and I will be forever grateful to have met them. Miller's Pub has a bright sign that shines on Wabash; you absolutely can't miss it. If only every bar had people that shone as bright inside...

I ordered the cream of asparagus soup, Greek salad, salmon with dill butter and switched out the potatoes that came with it for for the Irish potatoes. The Irish potatoes were mashed potatoes with horseradish added. The cream of asparagus soup was absolutely amazing. Very rich and creamy and perfectly made. A surprising find at any restaurant.  The Greek salad was on point and considering we have gone to Greek-town in Chicago quite a few times just so I can have a salad, I would think I would know by now. The salmon was absolutely amazing and I really enjoyed the Irish potatoes.  The place has a wonderful historical atmosphere. The service was fantastic. We went there with our son and daughter for dinner before leaving Chicago and it was a perfect end to our weekend. Cannot wait to go back there and try more items on the menu. Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal immensely. Everything was delicious and there were no complaints about any of the food.

Love this place. I don't go to the Loop often, but this place is excellent. The servers let you be and enjoy the food for the most part. The atmosphere is old school, and I like that. They have Gumball Head in the fall, and Zombia Dust in the summer, which is a win all around. The Patty Melt and Burgers are great! I love the fat, perfectly breaded onion rings. The prices are great too. If you're in the Loop, give it a try. You'll wanna be a regular.

So Miller's has been around forever, has a great story but is just nothing too special. They are like an upscale diner with lots of beers on tap and no ok menu. Nice staff, but you might have to remind them of things and ask for things several times.  I had a Greek salad which was decent. The rest of group also had salads. The Caesar was standard, the Bistro came with onion strings on top which were soggy.  Overall C+ service and expected pricing for crown town Chicago. I am not sure I would come back by choice but I do like supporting local business owners.

Went in here along with my group of friends who had come down to Chicago. But was quite disappointed to see that they did not have many choices in food. But the food that we ordered was yummy and delicious especially the chocolate sundae. Also, I was not very much happy about the service as it was very slow and not very enthusiastic. And after we had paid the bill they kept staring at us ,  I don't know why but they kept doing it and we felt really awkward and so we had to leave the place.

If dying of thirst and need a break, come here and get a green river float. A bit more pricey than if you were to get one in the region, but still equally delicious. Especially if you're from out of town and have never had this kind of pop. I always bring it back with me to NE. Miller's is a little dark inside, but altogether has a pleasant atmosphere. The French fries are pretty good to munch on too.
I love Miller's Pub. Classic Chicago.  Great pork chops.  Everything is really good including service. Very attentive and friendly.  Highly recommended.

It's hard to believe that there are not a ton of food choices in this particular area of the city late at night on a weekend. We stopped by Miller's Pub because it was close by, open, and the thought of pub food sounded just right.  Service was a bit slow and not very courteous. Wasn't too much a big deal since we were busy chatting but the waiter could have come by more often.  We ordered a New York strip steak, bacon cheeseburger, and cheese curds for an appetizer.  But hold on, they brought out rolls that were hard as stone and packets of butter that was still wet and frozen. Not a very good start.  The cheese curds were tasty. It's hard to go wrong with cheese curds but these were well above average. My steak could have been better. I've had my share of steak and this just tasted "cheap". Wasn't too fond of it and mostly just enjoyed the mashed potatoes it came with.  I'd come here for a drink or some snacks but I would travel a few more blocks to get a better meal.

Miller's is a great spot to sit at the bar and people watch. A good location near public transportation. The food is good, nothing amazing, but it is always delicious. They always have a good Three Floyd's on tap (but isn't all Three Floyd's good?) Highly recommended if you want a non-pretentious, down to Earth experience.

Fantastic.  From the minute I walked in I smelled the Ribs I was optimistic.  Ribs or rueben?  I took a chance in the rueben.  The unsweetened iced tea was delicate and refreshing.    A good sign.   They just took away a nearly clean plate.   Great rueben.  The whole thing was great. I'm a happy guy

So disappointed! Several things went wrong. Appetizer Buffalo style wings came out raw. 20 minutes after taking our order we found out that 2 of our 6 plates we sold out! 10 minutes later all of our food was brought out. 2 of the 6 plates were incorrect. We didn't bother sending them back. As we were leaving we asked if they could call a cab for a party of 6. They told us to just wait outside. After 15 minutes I asked again if they could give me a number I could call. They told me to just go around the corner. We called an Uber that charged us peak surcharge & cost a lot more money! The ambiance of this place was really cool...everything else was a huge disappointment!

Recently, I had met couple of friends at this Loop institution before seeing a play at a near by theater.  Upon arrival, I certainly got the feeling of an old-time bar/restaurant with it's dark wood and the layout of the booths and tables. Since all of my party wasn't present, I was asked to wait in the bar area.  The area was full of types of clientele.  Once all of my friends had arrived, we were seated.  The server had greeted us, went over the menu and took our drink order.  When he had returned, the order was taken.  We had ordered a Cearsar Salad, the Grecian Chicken (takes 30 minutes) and a burger.   Within the 30 minutes, our food was delivered.  We were all very happy with our selection.  The server did check in with us just once then went MIA.  Took a while to receive the bill. I would return and would recommend this restaurant.
Don't do it!!! Terrible service...sub par food. Just walk your happy ass a few more minutes and go anywhere else

We were walking back from the aquarium.  Just off Michigan avenue we deviated to find a nice place to grab a drink and appetizers.  We struck gold.   From the moment we walked it we knew this place was special.  We felt important from when we walked in   Great atmosphere and the service is 5star.   This felt like Chicago    It is a must stop if you are an out of towner.  They know how to service a client and have food that is impeccable.

Happy place!  Instant seating for 1 at prime time on a bustling Saturday night.  Quick, attentive, and friendly service; terrific local IPA draft recommendation.  Enjoyed avgolemono soup, spanokopita, and martini with blue cheese olives so generous I couldn't finish it. Very diverse jovial crowed - thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of the experience.  They take good care of you, your tastebuds, and your tummy here, and the prices are quite reasonable. Rare to find a place this pleasing - fun soundtrack, too!

Fantastic.  Chicago landmark.  Old fashioned respectful service.  Google the name, read the history, not much more I can add but I will tell you about the Irish Lamb Stew I had on St. Patty's Day:  silky smooth, so good that I noticed the potatoes and carrots tasted like the lamb!  I didn't mind eating my veggies! Take your time here, enjoy the ambience as you do the meal.

Yes good classic place. Sort of a time warp in here back to the 60's or 70's. Greek owned as so many Chicago places are with real comfort food and good service. Homemade soup very good and so was the prime rib. Enormous selection of draft and bottle beer with all the classic cocktails you could think of. Steps away from the Palmer House.

Food was great! Had the Cajun catfish on st party's day parade Saturday nite... Grilled perfectly and tasted super fresh.  Amazing on such a busy night.  Would like to return and try the burgers. Saw someone order it and they looked great... And the drinks are great... Wish they had Guinness but everything else is excellent !
Great place to go to after work. Nice beer selection  and the food is above average. I'll take one star off for the price, since the beers tend to be a little pricey.
